loadDataSourceFromFile

public static DataSource loadDataSourceFromFile(java.lang.String viewName,
                                                java.lang.String dataSourceId)
                                         throws com.archibus.utility.ExceptionBase

Creates data source instance for specified view name and data source ID.

Finds cached data source definition and creates a copy of it, so that cached definitions are never accessed directly and thus cannot be changed from the calling code.

If the data source is not found in the cache, loads the view object containing the data source, then adds loaded data source to the cache.

Parameters:
viewName - View file name without extension, i.e. 'ab-ex-wr-grid'.
dataSourceId - Data source ID attribute as defined in the view, i.e. 'wr-ds'.
Returns:
DataSource
Throws:
com.archibus.utility.ExceptionBase

loadDataSourceFromCache

public static DataSource loadDataSourceFromCache(java.lang.Object context,
                                                 java.lang.String viewName,
                                                 int groupIndex,
                                                 java.lang.String dataSourceId)
                                          throws com.archibus.utility.ExceptionBase
Creates data source instance for specified view, group index, and optional data source ID.

This method is for backward compatibility with Web Central 17.1 and is not recommended to use in new code.

Parameters:
context - Web Central context object, such as UserSessionImpl.
viewName - View file name without extension, i.e. 'ab-ex-wr-grid'.
groupIndex - 0-based index of the afmTableGroup in the view.
dataSourceId - Data source ID attribute as defined in the view, i.e. 'wr-ds'.
Returns:
DataSource
Throws:
com.archibus.utility.ExceptionBase

addIfAbsent

public static DataSource addIfAbsent(java.lang.String viewName,
                                     java.lang.String dataSourceId,
                                     DataSource dataSource)
Adds data source instance to the cache using viewName:dataSourceId as a key. If the data source has already been cached, does NOT replace it.

Parameters:
viewName - View file name without extension, i.e. 'ab-ex-wr-grid'.
dataSourceId - Data source ID attribute as defined in the view, i.e. 'wr-ds'.
dataSource - DataSource instance to be cached.
Returns:
Data source instance in cache.

addOrReplace

public static DataSource addOrReplace(java.lang.String viewName,
                                      java.lang.String dataSourceId,
                                      DataSource dataSource)
Adds data source instance to the cache using viewName:dataSourceId as a key. If the data source has already been cached, replaces the instance in the cache with the new instance.

Parameters:
viewName - View file name without extension, i.e. 'ab-ex-wr-grid'.
dataSourceId - Data source ID attribute as defined in the view, i.e. 'wr-ds'.
dataSource - DataSource instance to be cached.
Returns:
Data source instance in cache.

addOrReplace

public static DataSource addOrReplace(java.lang.String viewName,
                                      java.lang.String dataSourceId,
                                      DataSource dataSource,
                                      boolean loadAndAttachDefinition)
Adds data source instance to the cache using viewName:dataSourceId as a key. If the data source has already been cached, replaces the instance in the cache with the new instance.

Parameters:
viewName - View file name without extension, i.e. 'ab-ex-wr-grid'.
dataSourceId - Data source ID attribute as defined in the view, i.e. 'wr-ds'.
dataSource - DataSource instance to be cached.
loadAndAttachDefinition - If true, loads the data source definition from file and attaches it to the data source.
Returns:
Data source instance in cache.

remove

public static java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.String viewName,
                                      java.lang.String dataSourceId)
Removes object from the cache if it exists.

Parameters:
objectKey -
Returns:
Removed object if it was in the cache.
